IntroScene: ^Well, here we are, two days later and out of rations... But we made it.
^Technically, we had food available. The lichens we found were edibl-
^EDIBLE MY ASS! That thing looked mushy and disgusting, ew! I prefer starving.
^If someone hadn't kept triggering traps, maybe, just maybe, we would have enough spell slots for goodberries, but given our track record I'm saving all the spells for the heals...
^I hope you step on a trap, stingy.
^I mean, you will do all the walking on things we haven't before, "Scout".
^Alright, alright, everyone... Let's be a dear and stop with the petty squabbles ~ I saw a nice lute in town, and we've got a treasure to hunt.
^Remember, we are not here to plunder, this is a sacred place.
^Of course, of course, we are just doing... Archeological research.
^Yup. That's it, that sounds totally right. I'm not going to yoink anything at all.
MainSceneFirstLoad: ^Seems like the main door is sealed... But there are more paths to take.
^So, four rooms... four of us. Simple math.
^So we split the party to unseal it faster.
^(Seems like everybody already picked the room they are interested in... I should get going too.)
PuzzleRogueFirstTile: ^... I really hope the rest also have death traps and I didn't just get the densely packed with traps room.
PuzzleMageFirstLoad: ^Well, if that's here, then surely runes are soon to follow somewhere. It seems to be displaying them in an order...
^I think I could manage to play the order again if I inspect the crucible too... Maybe the order is important?
^Good thing I always keep my grimoire at hand. [Spacebar]
^I never quite bothered to learn rune reading by heart...
PuzzleClericFirstLoad: ^Huh, an array of glyph mirrors. These ruins must be from some religious group.
^Normally you would use these as a password of sorts. It makes sure you are part of the group, as you would need to know the symbol to make.
^It makes a nice tool, as it avoids having to draw and erase glyphs on the same space, along with the unsealing mechanism.
^Well, let's check my book of lore, it should come in handy. [Spacebar]
^I wonder which symbols are required here... Perhaps I should also take a look around.
PuzzleClericOloMask: ^Oh, well that's unexpected, a mask of Olo here... Lucky it was me who found it. I already feel dizzy...
^The others would have fallen for his aura. Thank you, Father of preservation for granting me your protection.
PuzzleClericPermasMask: ^A mask of... Is this Permas? or was it Permut? I hope the Boss doesn't get mad. the mask is very damaged. No matter, the other is bound to be nearby.
PuzzleClericPermutMask: ^A mask of... Is this Permut? or was it Permas? I hope the Boss doesn't get mad. the mask is very damaged. No matter, the other is bound to be nearby.
PuzzleBardFirstLoad: ^My! My! What do we have here?
^I did not know we were in the fancy kind of decrepit ruins. If it isn't an Orchestrion!
^I never imagined I would find something like this here!
^I should try and tune it up, make it sound nice, and see if I can listen the recorded song for my repertoire ~
PuzzleRogueWrongCharacter: ^What do you mean that you have reconsidered? ;-;
PuzzleMageWrongCharacter: ^Have you learned runic in these few hours?
^I'm plenty sure you won't stand a chance in there, so just let me handle this one.
PuzzleClericWrongCharacter: ^There's a certain... holiness to this room, I shall be the one to go in.
^(I also checked the others and I prefer this one... I refuse to go to the trapped one.)
PuzzleBardWrongCharacter: ^Would you mind if I go in this one? I hear a faint melody from within...
^It's already starting to get stuck on my head! I need to hear it properly.
^Besides, we all know I'm the only one here that knows how to play an instrument.
SwapDialogueCleric: ^Tired of working? I Guess I can give it a go now.
SwapDialogueBard: ^Finally, I can have some action too!
RogueStatueInteraction: ^Huh, that's a disgusting looking... What is this exactly?
^Oh, yeah... The puzzle. Let's hope I can get through without triggering any traps!
MageStatueInteraction: ^Looks biological but th- then again- again-   *R*   again- again-   *A*   again-
^Damn, what was the order again? I’m so going to study rune reading when I get out, would save me so much time.
ClericStatueInteraction: ^I should focus on the mirrors, better be out quick to heal the cat.
BardStatueInteraction: ^Yes the song! I almost lost the melody! silly me, I should better focus.
PuzzleRogueSolvedAlready: ^Nope. Nop. Yesn't. Nay. No. Nuh-huh. Not going in there again.
^I already had enough ancient magic thrown at me for today, thanks.
PuzzleMageSolvedAlready: ^It should be done already... Did I solve it wrong? Didn't see any red the last go...
PuzzleClericSolvedAlready: ^I shouldn't go there again. I already paid enough attention to other gods, and I don't want the Boss to get jealous.
PuzzleBardSolvedAlready: ^I already tuned it up... I should start noting down the melody instead!
FinalCorridorScene: ^It seems like the door has opened... Your turn now, "Scout".
^What do you mean "Scout"? I'm not playing your games!
^I get what she's saying though, I think you should go first too...
^Wait, what? Why?! I'm not even a tank! I have paper-like HP!
^Same as us... But have you noticed that we are all ranged spellcasters?
^Indeed, we provide "Cover" and "Protection". You attack with knives, melee range... So, go now, "Scout".
^C'mon don't worry, I'll ready a Shield spell in case anything goes wrong.
^Isn't the Shield spell a self-targetting only spell?
^... Who the hell taught him magic?
^I might have taught him a lil' bit of magic... you know, just a cantrip or two...
^Please, I already went throught the pressure plates... ;-;
^C'mon, We'll be right by you. I'll even cast bardic inspiration!
^Sigh... (She just wants to play her instrument.) Okay...
FinalRoom: ^Wait, this is all? A fricking coffin?
^It is a bit... Dissappointing though... Maybe there's something of value inside?
^Mhmmm, I dunno... I mean it's not like they'll miss it but... Graverobbing?
^Well, I'm not leaving with my hands empty so dont mind if I do ~
^You alright there bud? You went sil-
EndingBad: ^Yes, there's nothing here. Nothing worth it.
^Why did we even come here guys? Haha...
^No idea, but let's just put this behind us.
^Yes, better not idle too much here.
EndingGood: ^A locket? Like, the ones you keep a picture in?
^Hey it's not my fault! See? It looks like it should have a keyhole or something but I can't see anything of the sort.
^And how do you know it's a locket and not a pendant?
^Well, there's a very thin gap in the middle, I can pry it a lil' bit with a claw. But it is very rusted.
^Nope, looks like... I dunno, some metal. I'm no goldsmith.
^Well, I guess it's better than nothing, shall we leave then?
